description: started using it in cases where firefox would hog too much resources on old pc-s, but grown to like it even more.
summary: fast and works, even on realy old pc-s

description: Epiphany works great for me. It is lite and beutiful and first of all much functional. I recommend it.
Every single video I try to watch on this app shows an error that says "HTML 5 video not properly encoded"
I wish I could delete it, but the pureos store fails at deletion too!
summary: Rubbish. Oops, oops, oops, oops, oops... Never succeds wherever you go

description: I'm developing a website and need to test in a webkit based browser. I tried both the Flatpak and the deb package. The Flatpak can't access local files, and the deb crashes immediately after launching it.
It fits in with the desktop so nice that I wish I could like it...but it's just SOOO SLOOOOW.
summary: I wish I could like it

description: it does not save login user and password for insecure web pages which is ok if you want high security level, but there should be an option to override it.
summary: cannot bypass blocking of saving password for insecure web pages

description: Can't even do basic browsing. Unable to login to facebook. google maps stutters, flickers on zoom in and zoom out. Webkit webprocess always quits and crashes.
I like the clean and simple interface. Too bad it doesn't support web extensions yet in the stable build. Its great for testing websites though for the moment, and occasional use.
summary: Great Application, Can't Wait for Extentions

description: It can run websites, you can search stuff, pretty much like any browser, but can't run certain websites correctly and freezes a lot. firefox is much better.
Would expect it to work righ out of the box without searching for optimization settings. Nice and minimal interface...but...very laggy, freeze constantly...slow and unresponsive
Completely fails with loading youtube videos, and can't remove via the Ubuntu Software app
summary: Can't load youtube videos, can't remove

description: Need to improve performance. It's use a lot of cpu and laggy. Need to add extensions store to easy install extensions.
summary: Need to improve performance. It's use a lot of cpu and laggy

description: cannot delete cookies
Installed it, tried to load a website, nothing happened. Deleted it.
summary: Installed it, tried to load a website, nothing happened. Deleted it

description: I installed a webpage as application, but later I am not able to remove it. There is no any other way to remove installed app.
summary: Delete button in application manager is not working

description: Running websites was sometimes slow, moving around the window was jolty. I did enjoy the interface, felt native to gnome which was nice. I can't wait for them to integrate Libadwaita.
Video player performance much better than before, but searc for images is garbage. Cant render smooth too many image in google results. Slow, laggy. :/

Very cool that there is someone else making a browser with somewhat meh engine but okay. Sadly PWAs on certain sites are amazingly laggy and virtually unusable. There is no image from clipboard pasting. Default SE is DDG which is now also bad, would suggest Qwant because it has so many more features. Can't change font nor font size. Something about FF that makes this still feel a little too simple :( Can we get video support please, so annoying when scrolling Instagram.
This browser can't even play a 1080p video on YouTube without lag!
vfvfgbvgbvfdxvdfv
I'm having a webkitgtk issue and hoping to solve it by install this. Nope, browser won't load. And now it can't be removed...
Its a little clunky, But seems to work ok, Had a few pages randomly crash like youtube, Not a replacement for firefox or chrome, But works if needed

Tried but nope. Really clunky and not worth the hassle figuring out if it could be as smooth as fiefox. Baffling grey gaps on rendered pages (bbc new etc). Scrolling is jarring. Seen enough in the first minute to kick this to the curb.

Browse is an excellent browser, that shines because it is fast and is well integrated with Gnome, both aesthetically and functionally, . It has built-in support for ad-blocking, and pop-up blocking, as well has saving passwords, and everything else you would expect from a modern browser. 
Plays all those html5 media you find on the web just fine, using the gstreamer backend.
The only downside to it is the lack of support for the popular extensions found in other browsers ecosystems. Hopefully that is in the roadmap!
I recommend it, and is my preferred way to surf the Web!
summary: Great browser, just lacks popular extensions support

description: The feature that I love most is that you can make web apps with eiphany(gnome web)
Has a lot to learn from firefox et al.
summary: Lacks Ad-Blocker ability. Basic Gnome 3 app

description: It may not be the most complex web browser but it works just fine for me. I like the fact that it is simple.
Got crash when imported bookmarks.

Please change the icon though. It kind of looks ugly and makes this awesome browser apper old at first. I was just about to install chromium but when I opened this browser, I realised I actually didn't need chromium at all. I think I might just find its .desktop file and assign the chromium icon to it.
summary: just as simple as I like it!

description:
It is a very well integrated web browser and it performs mostly well. Only thing I dislike is the missing ability to switch tabs with CTRL + TAB (CTRL + Pg Up/Down is quite cumbersome since it requires two hands).

I would recommend it to everyone looking for a polished webbrowser for GTK desktops. Qt users should take a look at Qupzilla which is also a bit faster than GNOME Web.
Some websites don't work and it sometimes crash but it's fast and have good integration with GNOME.
Got crash when imported bookmarks.
It is not for people who want to have hundreds of tabs and who keep their whole life on the web. But if you are looking for a simple, small, fast browser, then this one might be the answer!
summary: A simple browser for simple use cases

description: This Browser rocks in terms of speed, but have some compatibility issues.
This is a very good web browser and I would use it, but the maximum resolution on YouTube is 360p. If that weren't the case I would actually be able to use it as my web browser.

Love it, simple, has dark theme (ThumbsUp), but it browses slow (it might be 'cause I used/tested DuckDuckGo search engine). I have tried one after the other all popular browsers, for a sake of speed I landed back at Opera, but overal, GNOME Web would be next best thing after high heels, uuupss, I meant Opera.
Would recommend to anyone who is annoyed with pops and whistles, GW lets you build from ground up, as per user's likings.
Very Sparse. No Plugins. No Un-install 8(
Installed it on Fedora 27. Now I can't get rid of it. The browser itself is not bad, but seems to be missing support for some HTML5 features...

I have come to use GNOME Web after ditching Firefox because of Mozilla's recent decisions and actions, it is a great browser. I have one issue with it though, you can't watch YouTube videos in anything above 360p. I have worked around this by using either VLC or GNOME MPV to stream them instead. Other than that I love all the features.
summary: Very good browser with one issue

description: Not happy one bit with the layout
Nothing beats Web Kit and Epiphany when it comes to Desktop integration. It just needs more users to develop faster.
While you may look for a browser that integrates well into your desktop, this is not it. For some reason the developers chose to hardcode the Adwaita theme for Incognito Windows.
I usually have quite a few tabs in my browser and I prefer to create apps for some of the more important websites that I use so I can alt tab between windows.
summary: I really like the ability to save websites as apps

description: epiphany or gnome browser provides a simple and minimalist way to surf the web. it looks a lot like the new safari from mac OS but with fewer bells and whistles. it doesn't yet support popular extensions and the bookmark system is quite inefficient for people that use that way of surfing to quickly visit sites then leave. the simple interface is cool at first glance but compromises a lot on usability and customization. it's still young so will wait to see how it goes. tested on fedora 28 workstation in 2018 June with gnome 3.28 on xorg with default nouveau driver on quadro k1200.

This web browser is fast but have some problem . In youtube sound is came fast than video, video is going and broken . And also a problem that 360p is default and than after 360p , 720p is the next one . The 480p is missing . Video resolution is also bad .

I love the look and feel of GNOME Web. The system integration is really useful, the minimalist design keeps the web content center stage, and it fits right in with the rest of the GNOME apps. But there are some issues. Firstly, it lacks support for MSE, which is required for high resolution YouTube playback. Secondly, the performance isn't quite there when compared to Firefox or Chromium. I can't wait to see how things look in the next few releases, when hopefully these issues can be resolved.
summary: Great experience, lacking media support and performance

description: The best integrated web browser on GNOME, fast, stable, private and easy to use.
Fast and simple to use. Firefox Sync support is very nice as well!

I don't mind it but its really kinda 'meh', I think it would be a better use of their time taking a browser like firefox or something similar and reworking it with their own standards and integrations instead.

Using Web as my main browser right now. It crashes pretty often, and videos are often rendered poorly or loop when they shouldn't. For most functions it works well. I like that it has only features I use.
summary: Simple and functional, but very buggy

description: Too buggy. Freezes all the time watching YouTube videos. Keeps showing a red screen for no apparent reason.
Doesn't play most streaming formats
summary: Integrates well but lacks basic functionality

description: 2019 wowwww!!!

When the internet cuts out the download stops and doesn't continue when a connection is re-established automatically as seen on Firefox. Please fix this issue. Also a downloads tab with the ability to retry or refresh would be nice.
summary: Great MINIMAL browser. Just fix downloads

description: I have kubuntu as my linux distro and this browser is fast but very basic bookmark controls and renders pages very small. I can change the zoom setting but it reverts bck to the original setting as soon as I move from that page. Icons and toolbar are also tiny - thank goodness for tooltips so i could see what the very small marks represented, uninstalling - sorry

Free from corporate fox and chrome, once I dug up that you can change the tab bar to left, this browser became 100% easier to use, use dconf-edditor /org/gnome/epiphany/ui, also add adblock lists as described on arch wiki. I wish that the tabs became stylised like in eolie and youtube volume icon stopped glitching.

This browser supports many modern web standards and is extremely lightweight. It has a new sync feature and integrates perfectly with GTK and QT themes. It is my main browser and can be used as such in most cases.
GNOME Web is overall very similar to Apple Safari, although it may have a simpler design.
summary: The best web browser for GNOME!

description: This is a very well-integrated browser for the GNOME Desktop Environment. Love the gesture support on my laptop too, it's silky smooth! The only problem I'm encountering is that it seems to perform not as well as Firefox.

No Home page button,not able to put any extension/plugin,not stream videos "youtube" (as a test site to check how to it is working),not even browse some simple sites correctly.i saw something like http:google.com... it is put itself.after may be 10 years development at this age/time still not working correctly..
Gestures working out of the box, really cool!

There is no preference in this version
We cant manage cookies, password, etc
I've been enjoying as my off-again, on-again daily browser, but it bugs out on certain websites like Reddit. It will stop scrolling and crash, forcing me to reload the page.
Great browser! Just like Safari.
it is not ready for daily usage. Scaling problems.
This browser, GNOME WEB, might provide a way for users who can refuse to use Chrome, Firefox, etc.,  while those web-browser gather users private information for dirty purposes.
I think pinned tabs must have addressbar insensitive.

This is a great browser, but until version 3.34 it had a number of bugs and missing features. Now, it can be fully used as an everyday browser, and is especially great because of its GNOME integration (any website can be a progressive webapp and it supports installing GNOME extensions from the browser, only browser with full GNOME HIG compliance.) The only problem with it seems to be that it isn't included with most distributions.
I was afraid to get GNOME browser for fear it would lack many features. but after trying it out I was very pleased, especially with it's speedy webapp handling and simplistic design. Love it!
summary: perfect browser, great PWA and html5 support

description:
Clean, modern ui. Some tweaking/customization options not available. Lacks fully functional/configurable ad blocker like uBlock Origin. Not hardened (or hardenable) like Tor Browser.

Yet.
crash every time and cant load web pages
this takes the ram as equal to chrome does . idk why this isnt minimial
Simplicity is awesome
Youtube only halfway works. If you resize the window, it goes nuts and freezes for 15 seconds. Firefox and chrome work perfectly fine. No thanks.

A must have as a default browser to open in-app links etc.
I don't want to open the behemoth of a browser like Chrome or Firefox every time an app tries to open a link.
In fact it is also perfect for general browsing needs. 
If you want advanced functionality. Load up Chrome or Firefox. If you just want to check a blog, browse social sites and check mail. No need to use anything else. This browser works best.
I tried Firefox, Chrome, and even Brave, but the specific website was presenting problems. Simplicity is awesome.

Running in a Wayland session I'm finding it slow & buggy as hell. I'll see if there is a flatpak or snap and see how either/or run and post results IF different.
Probably be better for the LTS coming (19.10)
At Dec 2019, chromium and chrome and firefox was super slow. I uninstall them and try GNOME web and it way faster. love it!!
summary: dec 2019, chromium and chrome and firefox was super slow

description: Update your snaps, so I can use that instead
why gvdb-file?special way?)))
summary says it all

Error shows in dev-tools:
```
This page contains the following errors:

error on line 43 at column 8: Opening and ending tag mismatch: link line 0 and head
Below is a rendering of the page up to the first error.

WI.sharedApp = new WI.AppController; WI.sharedApp.initialize();
```

I really enjoy using Gnome Web on my 2-in-1 laptop. It supports the same touch gestures in Chrome such as pinch-to-zoom, touch-scrolling, and swipe to go back/forward with webpages. While page rendering is noticeably slower in comparison with Chrome/Firefox, it's still perfectly usable for my daily workflow. Also, video renders just fine as well without any screen-tearing.

Furthermore, the web-app integration is a very useful feature. Unlike Chrome, I can actually place web-apps inside application folders for the Gnome desktop. Making it more convenient with organization.

Obviously the lack of a password manager extension is a key flaw of this browser. However, by using Lastpass as a web-app and placing it in the dock, I'm able to circumvent this problem quite well. Hopefully extensions will be improved.
summary: A great touch-browser alternative to Chrome

description: This is a great web browser if you're using GNOME, and you just want a minimal browser that gets the job done without much hassle. I love the feature where it allows you to sync with your Firefox account, and I love how it blocks ads by default. I use this on GNOME 3.36 with Arch Linux, and I love it. The only 2 problems that I have with it are that sometimes YouTube videos fail to play, ad scrolling is a bit slow sometimes, and I wish that I had a little more configuration of the browser, but if you want a simple browser that gets the job done, GNOME Web is a great choice!
summary: My favorite web browser, but it has a few problems

description: but youtube won't pla

It's simple, precise, but the only thing i didn't like so much is that tabs occupies a great area of the screen, more than firefox, otherwise works perfectly on Ubuntu 20.04, thanks for the great work!
I like it's design and it looks modern but wish it had tracking prevention like Firefox. Hope more updates come out
summary: It's decent but wish it had Tracking Protection

description:
You can't manage history, can't manage cockoos, can't manage security, microphone, location, or anything else. 
The most primitive thing ever. Deleted immediately.
Clean, lightweight web app, the cool thing about this app it has pinch zoom event, it very useful if you deal with small word or other things

Is this real? HAHA almost 1 gig for a browser. Though I installed the outdated snap version of this browsere, i kind'a like it. It just doesn't most play HTML5 videos. But this this version -- a gig HAHA funny. But i want to install it 'cause i want to know what's in it. IT IS JUST AN INTERNET BROWSER.

Yes ,gnome web loads faster than firefox or chrome or any other
this makes search easier.Not much but decent customization feautures.
Its simple look is super.
Great UI integration with GNOME, it just needs some fingerprinting protections, like Firefox has, and perhaps support for extensions.
Light and fast. Good job.
summary: Best for web sites for see as applications

description: Good for Mint ,Debian ,Arch and Ubuntu
My other browers are doing just fine with youtube though, so it probably is the gnome web
summary: For some reason youtube is mute on it

description:
This browser is lightening fast and gives the most minimalist experience. I can't replace it with Chrome (or Chromium) but if I just want to open a popup page or do a quick search, I wouldn't add the bulky Chrome and always use this browser. 
The people who're giving bad reviews because of it's minimal features don't really understand the philosophy behind this browser.
summary: Best Minimal Browser for Basic Browsing

description: ok web browser. could be a lot better
Ive used this browser for a total of about 20 minutes and my fan has been running constantly.
summary: I wish there was a better app

description:
It is a good browser but need a big update to be useful on 2020 (like updated chromium/firefox base) and a better mobile view (plus if you consider now there is phosh).
For the rest is *enought* good and optimised

Der Werbeblocker ist Lichtjahre entfernt von Alternativen wie zB ublock origin usw. 
Das scrollen fühlt sich sehr "ruckelig" an, ab und an kleine Gedenkpausen (1-3 Sekunden) wenn man mit der Seite interagieren will während sie noch geladen wird usw. Ansonsten ganz okay, vor allem fügt er sich sehr gut in den Gnome-Desktop ein, sieht gut aus und ist nur mit dem nötigsten ausgestattet.
Ab und an leider viel langsamer als Firefox oder Chrome.

Hervorragend in Gnome integriert, schnell, einfach zu bedienen. Immer mal wieder Probleme mit Flash, Unity3D etc. Wenn man dafür auf einen anderen Browser ausweichen kann, ist Gnome Web ein wunderbarer Browser.
Ich vermisse die SSO Integration (Kerberos), STRG + Scrollen zum Zoomen und eine Gnome Keyring Integration für gespeicherten Passwörter

Lesezeichen lassen sich inzwischen kaum mehr ordentlich verwalten; einen Lesezeichenmanager gibt's nicht mehr. Der Export aus dem verwendeten Binärformat (gvdb) ist auch nicht mehr möglich. Zurück zu Chromium.
Der Browser ist gut, er ist schnell und einfach zu bedienen... Aber er scheint ein Problem mit html5 zu haben :/ ...z.B. twitch.tv kann er leider immer noch nicht abspielen..

Ich muss meine vormals positive Bewertung revidieren. Mittlerweile wurde der HTML-Export für Bookmarks entfernt und damit hat man bis auch den Sync mit Firefox de facto ein Lock-In für Lesezeichen. Das ist extrem ärgerlich und eigentlich indiskutabel. Außerdem wurde die Plugin-Unterstützung entfernt und damit lassen sich keine GNOME Shell Extensions mehr über Epiphany installieren. Wenn das der Webbrowser für GNOME sein soll, ist das indiskutabel. Ich kann Epiphany daher aktuell leider nicht empfehlen.
summary: Bookmark-Lock-In und inkompatibel mit GNOME Shell Extensions

description: deutlich schneller als Firefox und Ad- und Trackerblocker sind auch schon integriert wie beim Brave-Browser.

Ist stellenweise etwas langsam. 
Und der Browser erkennt leider keine YouTube-Videos.
Und manchmal konnten auch Webseiten nicht korrekt dargestellt werden.
Sehr langsam auf meiner Maschine, keine Ahnung was dem Browser fehlt. Von den Einstellungen her ist er eigentlich ziemlich gut.

Epiphany (oder Gnome Web) ist mein Standard-Browser seit mehr als einem Jahr, und er macht einen guten Job!

Ein kleiner Browser ohne überflüssiger Ballast, klarer UI und guter Funktionalität innerhalb Gnomes.
Für Anspruchvolleres reicht es zwar nicht immer (kommt aber auch auf die Seite an), dann ist Firefox aber immer zum Ausweichen vorhanden.

Für den normalen Betrieb aber ziehe ich Epiphany definitiv Firefox vor.
summary: Kleiner Browser für die meisten Jobs

description: bei manchen Videos vom Netz steht nur das das Vormat nicht unterstütz wird

Tolles, einfach zu bedienendes Layout welches sich gut in die GNOME-Oberfläche einfügt. Allerdings lässt die Performance zu Wünschen übrig und scrollen wirkt generell sehr hakelig. Auch der Werbeblocker erfüllt seine Aufgabe nur teilweise.
summary: An sich ein schöner Browser, aber nicht wirklich performant

description: Immer wenn ich versuche eine Webseite zu laden, funktioniert sie, man kann dann allerdings nichts mehr lesen da die gesamte Webseite rumbuggt. Kann daran liegen dass ich auf einem Raspberry Pi 4B bin.
Schrott. Öffnet bet 365 nicht.

Epiphany wird immer besser, chlank und prima aufgeräumte Oberfläche, perfekt in GNOME integriert, inzwischen auch stabil genug für den täglichen Gebrauch. Der Zugriff auf die Lesezeichen könnte noch vereinfacht werden mit separatem Button in der Headerbar. Die Unterstützung von X.509-Client-Zertifikaten fehlt leider noch und u.a. ein paar andere Sicherheitsapekte verdienen noch Beachtung.
summary: Inzwischen tauglich für den Alltag mit kleinen Abstrichen

description: Wenn man die Einstellung des Browsers erst suchen muss, also ich habe nicht gefunden, wo ich cache und cocies einstellen kann, dann spricht das nicht gerade für Seriösität.
Was soll man viele Worte machen, es ist einfach Müll. Linux insgesamt geht mit Riesenschritten zurück.
Sobald ich auf die Einstellungen gehe, um den Abgleich mit meinem Firefox-Konto starten will, schließt sich das Programm wieder.
Stimmt, Leute, das hier ist selbstabstürzender Müll. Aber Epiphany von Synaptic-Paketverwaltung läuft tiptop.
Klein aber Fein.
this stuff lacks all serious functionality.
Es un progreso increible, y la proxima versión promete tener Firefox Sync, pero hay cosas que necesito de Firefox que no puede ofrecerme otro navegador. (Extensiones mayormente).
summary: Podría ser mi navegador por defecto

description: Hace falta , esta esta convirtiendo en una buena alternativa para otros anvegadores, recomiendo probarlo
Lo recomiendo totalmente, es muy fluido, liviano, solo le faltan las extensiones de Mozilla que lo hacen mas completo y poder fijar las pestañas, por el resto excelente, gracias.
Por defecto, Gnome utiliza Epiphany que es un navegador de uso libre para el sistema operativo que utilizamos (Fedora 28, en mi caso) va como anillo al dedo. Es todos los navegadores en uno.
Le vendrían bien opciones como traducir texto o pagina. Tambien una ventana de favoritos tipo la que tiene archivos.
LA verdad es que necesita herramientas para acceder a varias paginas que aun utilizan flash player y desifrado para paginas como mega... Gracias y los felicito!

me gusta su sencillez. sin embargo no he podido hacer que reproduzca un video completo de you tube. No sé si me falte instalar algo... no lo he eliminado porque espero que se actualice a ver si ya se corrige algo...

A mi me interesaque el contenido del sitio se vea los mas grande posible, este navegador es simple cuando tenes una sola pestaña, megusta, pero cuando agregas pestañas, quita mucho espacio al contenido de la web.

Me gusta el espacio que brinda al navegar por internet en una pestaña pero cuando se abren varias pestañas, ocupan demasiado espacio, asi también algo que personalmente uso bastante es la barra de marcadores que me gustaría añadieran como algo opcional que el usuario puede activar si asi lo desea, finalmente una ayuda en el autocompletado en la barra de direcciones.
summary: Bastante bien pero debe mejorar aun más

description: Es una muy buena alternativa a otros navegadores, se adapta perfectamente al escritorio gnome y la función de crear aplicaciones web me encanta. Fluida y minimalista, aunque aún le falta algunas opciones en el tema de privacidad y seguridad.
Puede ser que falte instalar o configurar algo, pero es lento en cargar páginas.
Sencillo y eficiente. Es sin duda alguna un navegador para el uso diario. Felicitaciones. Espero continúen mejorando cada día.
Sin duda es un navegador poderoso e integrado a gnome. Se nota el potencial que tiene este navegador.
todoe sta bien dolo que no tiene html5 y no puedo ver video
summary: es buena.. lo unico malo es que no puedo ver youtube :c

description:
(SO Ubuntu Studio) Es muy bueno en este so pero su apariencia no es de mi agrado. 
Pero en este so para los demas que quieran instalarselo y no estan seguros, funciona muy bien todo, corre multimedia y no se cierra inesperadamente.
me encato es de lo mejor

No se pueden reproducir algunos videos. Es una lástima, es el que mejor se ve en gnome, tiene interfaz bonita y se puede ir atras y adelante al hacer un gesto con dos dedos, eso me gustó mucho. Lo usaría si no presentara problemas.

El motor WebKit es de calidad y rápido. El navegador de Gnome es ideal para su plataforma.

A parte de problemas ocasionales con Gstreamer, que se solucionan a las revisiones de WebKit y Gstreamer, estoy totalmente satisfecho. Es mi navegador de uso diario.

Otro problema menor es (a día de hoy) que algunas páginas webs (es problema de WebKit) no recuerda las contraseñas. Suelen ser pocas páginas, espero se solucione pronto.
No es el mejor, pero esta entre los favoritos mios. Deverianagregarle soporte para los videos streams

Este navegador está orientado al usuario que no pretende proteger su privacidad ni controlar los rastros de su navegación. Si quisiera hacerlo, no podría, pues no ofrece siquiera la opción de instalar complementos o prohibir scripts o seleccionar cookies. 

El diseño tampoco es la prioridad de este navegador: para abrir una pestaña nueva hay que situarse encima de la pestaña vieja, pues ahí colocaron el botón, como si quieran diferenciarse arbitrariamente de otros navegadores que sí se orientan al uso práctico.

Sólo lo conservo porque aún sirve para navegar sitios simples que no exijan cookies, porque está integrado a Gnome, porque es una de sus aplicaciones principales y uso este escritorio.
summary: Pésimo navegador que terminarán sustituyendo por los clásicos

description: "Lo sentimos. Parece que navegador web epiphany ha dejado de funcionar.": a alguien más le pasa? He probado desinstalando, reiniciando el computador e instalando de nuevo y nada, sigue saliendo el mismo error. Comenzó a suceder después de actualizar a f25 v.v
Es muy buena si estas usando Debian.

Excelente en Debian! 
Anda muy fluido y se integra perfectamente al tema del sistema, me sorprendió gratamente lo simple e intuitivo que resulto ser y su interfaz muy bien trabajada.
summary: Excelente en Debian, anda muy fluido y se integra perfectamente!

description: Me encanta la fluidez, sencillez a la hora de buscar, es rapidisimo.

Después de imprimir en firefox la página "https://servers.opennic.org/" que no me resultó nada aceptable, lo probé con esta otra aplicación. Totalmente satisfactorio. Lo único que por ahora no he visto ver el aspecto antes de imprimr.
Buen buscador y muy versatil!
summary: Buscador Very Absolute Nice to Search

description: Me parece buena pero debería actualizar mas a menudo ya que en es un navegador web
summary: es genial aunque le falta algo

description: Yo creo que la simplicidad es su principal caracteristica pero no por ello se deben dejar de lado ciertas cosas, añadan los botones de minimizar y maximizar, que ciertamente ayudarian bastante para poder trabajar de forma cómoda.

Tienes un diseño bastante bueno y agradable, pero lamentablemente no van tan bien, es bastante lenta y se cierra cuando te metes a preferencias. Asi que no puedes cambiar nada, ni el motor de busqueda, la escala, la fuente, etc etc etc. Le hace falta con urgencia una actualizacion y un mantenimiento
En mi caso lo utilizo como segundo navegador para programas de podcast en exclusiva, asi evito que se me cambien o pierda la secuencia de reproducci'on al navegar con el principal.
summary: Navegador sencillo y perfecto para tener segundo navegador

description: 5435353fddsfffhnj

Me gusta mucho, a mejorado mucho en las ultimas versiones.
Seria excelente que tuviera compatibilidad con web extencion, aunque en particular lo que mas necesito es la posibilidad de traducir las paginas o una parte del texto.

Saludos!
summary: Muy bueno, me encanta tener el mismo aspecto en todas las aplicaciones

description: A mi le gusta este navegador porque es descarga mas rápido.

Me gusta, pero Eolie es mejor a mi parecer, igualemente cuenta con el mismo problema al usar webkit y python no reproduce contenido con DRM, le haría falta eso, y ademas un mejor bloqueador de publicidad y traductor incorporado, quizas la posibilidad de plugins o opciones de "bloqueo" avanzadas no sería mala... En fin sigan mejorando buen trabajo!

Es un excelente navegador, para los que dicen que "No tiene HTML5" estan errados, HTML5 es un estandar web de lectura de etiquetados y plantillas de estilo, lo cumple de pie a cabeza, si no puedes ver videos es porque no tiene DRM y eso no tiene nada que ver con la decodificación de metadatos de la web, simplemente es la decodificación de un video por falta de un codec privativo o un medio para procesarlo, toda pagina que no requiera DRM se puede ver video sin problemas...

Buenos Días, mucho gusto este navegador se integra muy bien con gnome, ha mejorado mucho, sin embargo el bloqueador de anuncios integrado carece de eficiencia, el renderizado de páginas es algo lento, a pesar de estar basado en firefox no dispone de compatibilidad con sus extensiones.
Espero que siga mejorando, tiene un futuro brillante...

Navegador sencillo y funcional.
Para ciertas tareas sencillas va fenomenal.
aunque tiene problemas reproduciendo videos, aun así es 10/10
Fonctionne bien sur ubuntu 22. Pas très rapide, mais suffit pour faire des tests du moteur.
Très léger et interface simple, semble très bien mais impossible d'allelr sur youtube même si la navigateur est à jour

Avant Firefox était multitache et ne laissait pas de place à un autre navigateur sur mon bureau...et puis Firefox a supprimé la plupart des plugins dont le plugin java qui malgré sa lourdeur et les problèmes de sécurité qu'il engendre reste assez indispensable lorsque l'on souhaite afficher un site web utilisant le plugin java.
Gnome-web est ainsi le parfait navigateur complémentaire de Firefox : il permet d'accéder aux sites (que Firefox ne prend plus en charge) et d'en faire des applications Web.
summary: A fini par trouver sa place sur mon bureau

description: L'integration est evidement parfaite, sobre, puissant. Offre la possibilitée de creer des web app integrées au bureau, ce qui tombe bien car le moteur de rendu pour les applications canvas/svg est juste surpuissant.
Thanks, i love it ! Continue your great work !

Très bonne intégration au bureau GNOME, simple pratique et efficace. Il manque par contre des choses essentielles comme le 1080p de Youtube. J'ai aussi remarqué que le rendu Canvas est très lent par rapport aux autres navigateurs, dommage
que je garde en deuxième main pour la navigation web.
but pages crash a lot. I had to reinstall because it makes it unreliable if you have serious work online, you can lose all your work easily
summary: great app, very clean and simple

description: there is a bug when i launch a new video on Youtube the volume sound of Gnome desktop get higher automaticly please FIX it
très utile en cas de plantage du navigateur habituel,et pas le temps de réparer

L'application fonctionne, se synchronise avec Firefox Sync, bref, rendra service quand certains sites poseront problème avec Firefox. Pour le reste, pas d'extensions ni de plug-ins, et une interface qui me perturbe : pas moyen d'avoir un menu !
Et je n'utilise PAS google qui semble le seul proposé, donc pour moi c'est la porte !
summary: Moteur de recherche pas modifiable à 1e vue

description: Quel progrès ! J'ai suivi 'Web' aka 'Epiphany' depuis 2011 il me semble, lors de la sortie de Gnome-Shell : inutilisable, manquant cruellement d'option, pas d'anti-tracker, ergonomie douteuse, incompatible avec énormément de sites.. Et là c'est une pépite : intégration parfaite à Gnome, rapide (mais derrière Firefox et Chromium), avec un adblock intégré, une ergonomie efficace, visuellement très épuré, supportant Firefox Sync (un must), pas de plantage, les sites sont affichés correctement, possibilité de transformer les applications en sites web.. BRAVO pour cette évolution !!

J'ai du mal à comprendre ceux qui ne trouvent ni le menu ni le choix du moteur de recherche...après installation, en 10s, on trouve ces paramètres!

Par contre, pour regarder du streaming... pas la peine, dommage
summary: Bien pour une utilisation très basique...sans streaming

description: çà ressemble a safari
unable to play videos on kickstarter

Il est simple et rapide et c'est ça que j'aime, après le seul défaut c'est pour les vidéos, YouTube marche un peu trop au ralenti, c'est un peu dommage pour les personnes qui veulent regarder des vidéos sur ce navigateur.

J'aime bien ce navigateur, mais imprimer un PDF depuis celui-ci, ça ne marche pas du tout. A corriger.
J'aime la rapidité de ce navigateur.
ne se lance pas au demmarage

Je l'ai installé sous Débian 10, juste pour essayer à la base, mais du coup, ce navigateur deviens mon préféré au fur et à mesure. Je n'ai qu'une utilisation domestique d'internet, et ce navigateur fait son job parfaitement. Parfait avec Gnome 3, sobre, simple, affichage rapide, gestion simple des signets (favoris). Très bien.

Comme tout ces navigateurs bis: ne fonctionne pas sur rail-nation trouve même moyen de planter le pc.
Dommage c'est le mieux construit,
A revisiter.

g,é,n,i,a,l
super

Pc quadcores 3,2ghz,carte graphique non intégrée 4 go de ram, Ubuntu21, comme tout les navigateurs secondaires comme vivaldi Falkon, Brave,ne finit pas le jeu Rail-nation.com du groupe Travian.
C'est fatiguant de devoir secontenter de mozilla ou chromium avec la mode actuelle des attaques des virus sur les navigateurs .
Dommage votre navigateur est hyper rapide et sympa.
Vous vous enregistrez surla version test totalement gratuite rail-nation.com/ptr et tentez de lancer le jeu complètement.
Ca vous donnera l'occasion d'en faire un navigaeur polyvalent et moderne.
se ferme des une recherche

pas de possibilité de changer de moteur de recherche impossible de voir une vidéo en streaming pas si rapide que ça pas de synchronisation avec firefox aprés j'en ai eu marre j'ai désinstallé de xubuntu 20.04

Le navigateur et l'inspecteur ont l'air de fonctionner mais la fenêtre n'affiche aucun contenu.

Un clic droit permet d'inspecter un élément du DOM

On dirait donc que le DOM est rendu mais qu'il n'est pas affiché
summary: N'affiche aucun contenu sur Raspberry P400

description: Je ne comprends pas pourquoi certains parles des deffauts du Web qui pourtant n'existe pas. J'étais suivis par des pubs... inlassables des autres navigateurs et maintenant que j'ai installer ce navigateur, je me rend compte que le silence, la paix et la tranquilité existe pour de vrai. Raison de plus pour rester GNU/Linux.
Grâce à lui, je peux aller sur Internet avec un vieux vieux PC qui a 2 GO de ram. Il n'y a plus que lui qui soit proposé ici et qui le permet.

Génial, très rapide pour lancer et utilise : 1% de ressources par rapport à Firefox qui grimpe vers 50% !!

parfois il y a une image qui ne marche pas mais cela n'est pas dérangeant.
Plante (ne bugge pas, s'éteint carrément) à chaque clic sur mes préférences!! ?
summary: Pas pu aller plus loin que "mes préférences"

description: Navigateur parfait, fonctionne super bien. On ne peut pas trouver mieux.
Super navigateur web 100 % libre avec bloqueur de pub intégré. Seul le manque de délimitation entre onglets ouverts est à regretter.
Использую его только с одной целью - симуляция сафари. Рад что есть хоть какое-то решение чтобы не покупать мак. Минус за то анимации нагружают 8 потоков проца до 100%
Есть над чем работать, и много над чем.

Прекрасный и полностью открытый браузер, который не продаёт никакие данные своих пользователей. Идеально вписывается в GNOME, работая при этом быстро и не требуя много ресурсов. 

Дизайн, приватность и скорость работы — всё это про Epiphany.

В чём прикол? установил в лубунту и он ничего не открывает. каких-то пакетов не хватает? Разве они автоматом не должны подгружаться с установкой? В общем, браузер никакой. Как он работал в убунту уже не помню - наверно, сразу же лисой заменил.
не открывает страницы. удалил.
Легковесная прога.
На ютубе постоянно грузит процессор одной из программ, потом падает.
Не устанавливайте!
summary: При удалении устанавливаются Dolphin и Konqueror

description: На xUbuntu даже не устанавливается
При включении видео страница зависает, перезагружается и выдает ошибку
Схлопывается когда нажимаешь кнопку "Настройки". То есть "вам лучше незнать что там" ? Нунах, удалил.
Ну ни чего не работает, кроме текста и картинок.
Чтот он у меня плохо работате с ютубом(какие-то красные мелькания, но видео грузит нормально), не работают гном расширения. Но программа не крашится, сама работет нормально.

Браузер нормальный, но настройки очень хорошо спрятаны, нашел только с 4 раза. Оказалось, надо нажать на окно приложения ПКМ и нажать Настройки. Еще при просмотре видео на Ютубе каждые 3 минуты виснет, приходится закрывать, и открывать заново. Пользоваться не буду.

Не плохой браузер, работает быстро. Но без но никуда. У меня очень много закладок и в хроме они разделены по папкам, здесь к сожалению такого функционала нет(либо я не нашел) и криво работает прокрутка колесиком (дерганно) поэтому возвращаюсь на хром. Как исправят эти недостатки перейду на этот браузер.
Дико лагающий браузер на котором не работает некоторый функционал. Из плюсов только приятный дизайн похожий на сафари,в остальном - непригодный для сёрфинга клиент.

Прокрутка страниц не плавная. Ну и зачем тогда это?
Блокировщик рекламы встроен. Это хорошо.

Ставьте Pale Moon. Быстрый красивый браузер со всеми плюшками и безо всякой ненужной ерунды.
Неплохой браузер в связке с каким нибудь помощнее.
Даже gnom.org не загрузился. По моему "дремучий динозавр".

Поставил 1 звезду и написал отрицательный отзыв - выдало сообщение - "извините, что-то пошло не так..."
Ржу не могу!
Вынуждено ставлю 5 звёзд! )))))
Простой, минималистичный, удобный. Использую на RPI4.
Мало потребляет памяти, но можно одну вкладку за раз открыть и это неудобно. Хотя на современном железе и хром норм
Приложение которое разрабатывает команда GNOME не может открыть нормально сайт GNOME-LOOK.ORG ... это ... нет слов просто.
Где темная тема? Почему ее все еще нет в таком шикарном браузере?

Классический браузер, а не комбайн для всего который пожерает оперативную память.
Есть все необходимое:
1. Создание домашней страницы
2. Добавление (ручное) своей поисковой системы
3. Создания ярлыка для веб сайта. Очень удобно если есть Веб личный кабинет которым пользуешься постоянно
summary: Легкий и быстрый. то что нужно

description: работает очень медленно, часто виснит и слетает....
Не хватает некоторых функций, вынесенных на верхнюю панель. Например вкладок. А так замечательное приложение
Хороший веб-браузер только один - это отсутствие расширений и все же + 5 быстрый, удобный а это я считаю главные моменты.
Похож на Safari.
Замечательное приложение рекомендую
Как пользоваться данным браузером ? Ни в какую не хочет на Endless OS 3.9.5 открывать страницы.

Работает в Fedora 35, Gnome 41.3/Wayland.
Не хватает тёмной темы, но это уже придирки. Со своими задачами справляется на все 100%.
CPU占用率过高，多核心优化不够好，加载速度较慢，一点都不好用
只是为了让应用搜索栏可以实现网页搜索

用的是火狐内核但是比火狐内存占用小很多
速度比火狐慢，算是时间换空间吧
不是，这个内核叫 WebKitGTK
就图epipahny的极简界面，快慢反正也差不了多少
debian10.7,桌面环境gnome，安装版本40.2,尝试了debian应用商店中的deb发行版本和官方网站的flatpak发行版本，都一样播放视频一会儿就崩溃，搜索不到产生的原因，希望官方测试并修复此问题，谢谢！

刚刚安装，还没有熟悉。
1.可以同步firefox数据，密码、收藏等；
2.可以将页面制作成应用程序，赞！
3.没看到插件功能；
4.本地化不完整。
超级垃圾，没有flash....
安装后就处于崩溃状态，而且还不能重新启动
summary: 安装后就处于崩溃状态

description: 还可以，cpu占用太多了，浏览速度还行.
